result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heather L. Adams appeared in court with Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Court dismisses and read in this case in its entirety.  - rt

ADDRESS INFO for Heather L. Adams
Current: W2668 Willow Rd, Curtiss, WI 54422 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2017)
Prior: N1281 Oriole Drive, Stetsonville, WI 54480
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 11, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Heather L. Adams in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed standard motions.  Attorney Laufenberg indicates that his client's statements are admissible.  Defense has no objection to other motions filed by the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2017 at 09:30 am.  - rt
Motion hearing on May 1, 2017 at 04:15 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Healther A. Adams in court with Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for State of Wisconsin. Matter set for PTC.  Pre-Trial Conference scheduled March 23, 2017 at 11:00 a.m. ba
Status hearing on February 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heather L. Adams appeared in person with Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  There was a discussion regarding the bonds that were forfeited. Attorney Laufenberg indicated that he was objecting to the bond forfeitures because he requested the bond hearings be adjourned.  The court ordered that collection of the bond forfeitures be held in abeyance and  the issues of the bond forfeitures will be heard on a different date.  Court ordered on all the cases that bonds were forfeited that signature bonds that were originally ordered are ordered again with the same conditions that were originally ordered.  All of the defendant's cases are scheduled for a pretrial conference on December 1, 2016 at 3:00 pm.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
Objection to Proposed Revocation of Bond
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heather Adams appeared in person, in custody.  Defendant was in court to set bond for new charges.  Attorney Tlusty requested that the clerk begin bond revocation proceedings in all of defendant's other cases.  So ordered by the Court.  - rt
Consent for Substitution of Attorneys
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Heather L. Adams in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of the complaint; entered a plea of not guilty and requested a PTC.  Court set pre-trial conference to August 26, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. Bond Continued. ba
Adjourned initial appearance on June 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

Defendant Heather L. Adams in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicated that Attorney Goetz was her attorney.  Court advised her that she needed to reapply to the public defender's office,  She then indicated that she would be hiring Attorney Laufenberg from her tax refund.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond with booking.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  - rt
by Heather L. Adams
